subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations and their replication dynamics leading to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation and clonal expansion as drivers of mitochondrial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes age-related accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain defects and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights early-life mtDNA point mutations and their clonal expansion as contributors to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on clonal expansion of mtDNA deletions and their role in mitochondrial dysfunction during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains coexistence and selection dynamics of mutant and wild-type mtDNA via replication and degradation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes transcriptional feedback inhibition loss in mtDNA deletions leading to selective replication advantage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Attributes mtDNA mutation accumulation primarily to replication errors and spontaneous base hydrolysis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation, replication errors, and their impact on stem cell function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Clonal Expansion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced mtDNA mutation accumulation and positive feedback damage cycle contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial hydrogen peroxide production rate as a causal factor in aging via oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS and cardiolipin oxidation signaling triggering mitophagy, apoptosis, and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage accumulation to aging and calorie restriction effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial oxidative damage and free radical theory as drivers of mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial dysfunction-driven H2O2 signaling activating lipid catabolism and white matter degeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial dysfunction to nuclear genomic instability, DNA damage response, and aging via mito-nuclear communication.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects mitochondrial dysfunction-induced ROS to telomere attrition, genomic instability, and apoptosis in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows mitochondrial complex III deficiency causing nuclear DNA damage, aberrant cell cycle, and progeroid aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial energetic decline limiting ATP, impairing proteostasis, and contributing to muscle aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction-Genomic Instability and Telomere Attrition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial bioenergetic decline driving vascular aging, senescence, inflammation, and tissue degeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitophagy as a mitochondrial quality control mechanism whose impairment leads to mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mosaic mitophagy impairment in muscle fibers causing mitochondrial disease and aging pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details age-dependent decline in mitophagy causing accumulation of damaged mitochondria and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes coordination between mitophagy and mitochondrial biogenesis is disrupted in aging, leading to mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy Dysfunction and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitonuclear imbalance and mitochondrial unfolded protein response affecting mitochondrial proteostasis and aging.
